description: The Liberty Corps enforces order in Obscuria through authority, arrest, and judgment. Steam-powered law enforcement backed by federal mandateâ€”efficient, relentless, and incorruptible.

faction_features.name: Arrest Mechanics
faction_features.effect: Liberty Corps units can Arrest targets instead of killing them. Arrested units are removed from play and may score VP. Units with Grapple can initiate arrests more easily.

faction_features.name: Warrant System
faction_features.effect: Certain units (Warrant Officers, Detectives) can issue Warrants, marking targets for arrest. Units gain bonuses when engaging Warranted targets.

faction_features.name: Steam Technology
faction_features.effect: Many Liberty Corps units are powered by steam engines (Steam Constables, Black Mariah). They are reliable, heavily armored, and mechanically precise.

victory_objectives.description: Score VP for successfully arresting targets. High-value targets (Leaders, Mystics, Monsters) score more VP when arrested alive rather than killed.
Score VP for extracting arrested units from the battlefield via the Black Mariah or designated extraction points.
The Judge scores VP for passing judgment on arrested targets. Represents upholding the law through due process.
Score VP for controlling key locations (towns, crossroads, settlements). Liberty Corps establishes order through occupation.
Some scenarios designate specific targets (outlaws, rogue Monsters, insurgents). Score bonus VP for eliminating these threats.

composition_requirements.note: Liberty Corps forces must include at least 1 Steam Constable unit to represent frontline enforcement. Warrant Officers and Judges are limited to 1 each per army.

units.name: Steam Constable
units.lore: Uniformed enforcers in slab wool coats and iron helmets. Their steam backpacks drive piston-fists and batons built for arrests, not duels.
units.tactics: Frontline control. Grapple and Pinning keep targets in place for arrests and for loading into the Black Mariah. Shield Wall rewards constables operating in pairs.

upgrades.name: Steam Overpressure
upgrades.effect: Once per game: add +2" Push to a successful Grapple.

units.upgrades_note: May purchase universal upgrades: Gas Mask, Spare Parts

units.name: Field Technician
units.lore: Cable-haulers and wrench-hands who keep Liberty Corps machinery operational in places it was never meant to operate.
units.tactics: Support backbone. Keep vehicles, devices, and assets operational. Remove debuffs and keep the plan from collapsing.
units.upgrades_note: May purchase universal upgrades: Gas Mask, Spare Parts

units.name: Patriot Asset
units.lore: Cheap bodies in cheap uniforms---pressed into service, promised glory, issued a whistle and a pair of cuffs.
units.tactics: Flood lanes, contest objectives, and enable arrests. Trade lives for time and position.
units.upgrades_note: May purchase universal upgrades: Gas Mask, Spare Parts

units.name: Liberty Corps Detective
units.lore: Plain clothes, keen eyes, documented everything. The arrest warrant is already in their coat pocket---signed, stamped, and inevitable.
units.tactics: Deploy forward to reveal hidden threats. Mark priority targets for arrest or elimination. Use Runner to maintain positioning and escape engagement.

upgrades.name: Wire Tap Kit
upgrades.effect: Once per game, place a 3" radius marker on the battlefield. Enemies starting activation within this area are revealed as if by Scout.

upgrades.name: Warrant Badge
upgrades.effect: When this unit uses Mark Target, if the marked target is later Arrested, your controller gains +1 VP.

units.upgrades_note: May purchase universal upgrades: Gas Mask, Spare Parts

units.name: Warrant Officer
units.lore: The best at what they do. Steam-assisted reflexes, reinforced armor, and a perfect arrest record. They don't bring you in. They bring you down.
units.tactics: Elite arrest specialist. Use Fast to position for Grapple. Binding Rig works on Brutes and Monsters. More mobile than Constables but equally durable.

upgrades.name: Pursuit Boots
upgrades.effect: Gain +2" Move when activating to move toward an enemy unit marked for arrest.

upgrades.name: Reinforced Cuffs
upgrades.effect: Units arrested by this model cannot be rescued by allies (they must destroy the Black Mariah to free prisoners).

units.upgrades_note: May purchase universal upgrades: Gas Mask, Spare Parts

units.name: Pinkerton Marksman
units.lore: Private detective turned contractor. Their job isn't justice---it's results, documented and delivered.
units.tactics: Lane control and surgical removals. Mark priority targets for arrest or elimination.
units.upgrades_note: May purchase universal upgrades: Gas Mask, Spare Parts

units.name: Riot Harmonist
units.lore: A brass-backed crowd-control officer carrying a steam-powered bombardion. Used for signaling and for breaking resolve with weaponized sound.
units.tactics: Area denial and morale pressure. Sonic ignores Heavy Armor and cover bonuses. Keep spacing---friendly resonance is dangerous.
units.upgrades_note: May purchase universal upgrades: Gas Mask, Spare Parts

units.name: Liberty Corps Judge
units.lore: In Liberty Corps jurisdiction, Judges hold executive power in the field. They prosecute, sentence, and execute all in one. Their presence turns mob into firing squad.
units.tactics: Command hub. Authority negates enemy Suppression. Inspire boosts morale. Pass Judgment marks targets for harsh penalties. Position centrally to maximize aura effects.

upgrades.name: Law Books
upgrades.effect: Gain +1 use of Pass Judgment (twice per game instead of once).

upgrades.name: Judicial Robes
upgrades.effect: Friendly Liberty Corps units within 6" gain +1 to Quality checks when attempting to Arrest enemy units.

units.name: Black Mariah
units.lore: A steam-powered armored prison wagon. It doesn't bring help. It brings jurisdiction.
units.tactics: Primary scoring engine. Load restrained units and extract. If destroyed, all prisoners are released.
units.upgrades_note: May purchase universal upgrades: Gas Mask, Spare Parts

units.name: Classified Asset: Troll-Howitzer
units.lore: A restrained monster fused to artillery hardware. It fires because it hurts. It exists because paperwork said it could.
units.tactics: Deterrence through escalation. Every shot risks morale collapse on both sides.
units.upgrades_note: May purchase universal upgrades: Gas Mask, Spare Parts

units.name: Uncle Liberty
units.lore: The first President of the United States of Liberty. Half man, half machine, sustained by steam, myth, and unfinished business. He fights for Liberty---until Liberty demands more.
units.tactics: Devastating charge unit with Impact(3) delivering automatic hits. If killed, rises once as UNCONTROLLED---control alternates between players each round. High-risk centerpiece that becomes everyone's problem.

special_rules.Been Killed Seven Times: If Uncle Liberty is reduced to 0 Quality for the FIRST TIME: Remove all damage, place within 6" of death location, becomes UNCONTROLLED permanently. Control alternates each round (Round 1: opponent, Round 2: owner, etc.). Controlling player activates him, MUST move toward and attack nearest enemy. Cannot use choice abilities or score objectives. Regeneration works automatically. If reduced to 0 Quality while UNCONTROLLED: destroyed permanently, no VP awarded. ONE RESURRECTION ONLY.
special_rules.Guardian of the Land: Cannot be Arrested, Charmed, Transported, or Embarked. If destroyed after resurrection is exhausted, neither player scores VP.

units.upgrades_note: May purchase universal upgrades: Gas Mask, Spare Parts

universal_upgrades_note: Liberty Corps units may purchase universal upgrades from core rules (Gas Mask, Spare Parts, vehicle upgrades) where appropriate.
